StyleSheet.summary: An object implementing the StyleSheet interface represents a single style sheet. CSS style sheets will further implement the more specialized interface.

StyleSheetHref.summary:
The href property of the
interface returns the location of the style sheet.
StyleSheetHref.value: A string containing the stylesheet's URI.

StyleSheetMedia.summary: The media property of the interface specifies the intended destination media for style information. It is a read-only, array-like MediaList object and can be removed with deleteMedium() and added with appendMedium().

StyleSheetOwnerNode.summary:
The ownerNode property of the
interface returns the node that associates this style sheet
with the document.

remarks.para:
This is usually an HTML
<link> or
<style> element, but
can also return a processing instruction node in the case of <?xml-stylesheet ?>.

StyleSheetDisabled.summary:
The disabled property of the
interface determines whether the style sheet is prevented from
applying to the document.

remarks.para:
A style sheet may be disabled by manually setting this property to true or
if it's an inactive alternative style sheet. Note that disabled === false does not guarantee the style
sheet is applied (it could be removed from the document, for instance).

StyleSheetTitle.summary: The title property of the interface returns the advisory title of the current style sheet.

remarks.para: The title is often specified in the .

StyleSheetType.summary:
The type property of the
interface specifies the style sheet language for the given style sheet.

StyleSheetParentStyleSheet.summary:
The parentStyleSheet property of the
interface returns the style sheet, if any, that is including
the given style sheet.
